alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 3:18PM PDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warnings continue for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. Minor flooding is forecast to continue for the next several days for both rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Flooding at Beal Park on West Kettle River Road, west of Curlew. `Ol Swimming Hole Park in Curlew will be inundated. Flooding of yards and outbuildings along the river from the Canadian border through Curlew on both sides of the river. Some driveways on Kettle River Road will be flooded. Water will be over Customs Road near Riverview Lane and between milepost 5 and 6. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:15 PM PDT Wednesday was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 19.0 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.7 feet on 05/20/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Thursday morning at 800 AM PDT.
